provenance.name: Fitzwilliam Museum
provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1799-1800; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; by inheritance in 1862 to Captain F. J. Butts; anonymous owner or owners between 1880 and 1940; "acquired from a bombed house in 1940 by [the dealer James] Rimell" (Butlin 410); sold 1944 to George Goyder; by inheritance in 1997 to Goyder's heirs; given 2010 to the Fitzwilliam Museum but not officially accessioned pending investigation of the provenance of the painting.

desc.objtitle: The Christ Child Asleep on a Cross, Object 1 (Butlin 410)

objnote.p: Blake signed the work with his monogram in the lower right corner; see the textual transcription. An enhanced image of the monogram has been provided below. The painting was restored by John Hell in 1943.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This subject does not appear in the Bible, but there are a few pictorial precedents for the theme, including a painting by Guido Reni. Jesus is pictured as a young child, discovered asleep on a cross by Mary and Joseph. Jesus is nude, though there is a piece of cloth underneath his legs that might have fallen off of him. His legs are crossed at the ankles and his arms are raised horizontally. He is facing up, though his head is turned to face forward. He has short, curly hair and a halo, or at least an aura of light, around his head. Next to the cross and by Jesus's left hand lies a carpenter's square. Joseph, a gowned male with curly hair and a beard, stands to the right of the cross. He faces left and slightly forward, and appears to be looking at the woman to the left. His arms are raised at 45 degrees and he points to the cross with his left hand, forefinger extended, while holding a pair of compasses or dividers in his right hand. Joseph's left foot extends below the hem of his garment. To the right of the cross stands Mary, a gowned female with long, curly hair partly pulled up into a bun. She faces right and slightly forward and seems to be looking down at Jesus on the cross, with her arms bent upward and her hands clenched under her chin as though praying. The toes of both feet are visible beneath the hem of Mary's gown. To the left grow two kinds of flowers, probably lilies and roses. In the middle distance to the left of Mary are two leafy trees, their branches perhaps intertwined. The background is also marked with grass and leafy indeterminate vegetation. A river runs in the middle distance with hills and a mountain in the background. To the left of Joseph's right shoulder is the roof, wall, and perhaps chimney of a building, probably a house. The sky appears to be slightly cloudy, with coloring that suggests sunrise or sunset. The foreground is apparently grassy, with possibly a small plant below the cloth dangling from the cross.

component.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design lies the young Jesus on a wooden cross.

In the center of the design lies the young Jesus sleeping on a cross. He is nude, though there is a piece of cloth underneath his legs that might have fallen off of him. His legs are crossed at the ankles and his arms are raised horizontally. He is facing up, though his head is turned to face forward. He has short, curly hair and a halo, or at least an aura of light, around his head.
Next to the cross and by Jesus's left hand lies a carpenter's square, probably made of wood.

Joseph, a gowned male with curly hair and a beard, stands to the right of the cross. He faces left and slightly forward, and appears to be looking at the woman to his left. His arms are raised at 45 degrees and he points with his left hand, while holding compasses or dividers in his right hand. He probably used these, as well as the carpenter's square on the ground below Jesus, to measure the cross during its construction. He may even be measuring either the cross or Jesus, as though fitting his son to it. His left foot extends just beyond the hem of his garment.

To the left of the cross stands Mary, a gowned female with long, curly hair partly pulled up into a bun. She faces right and slightly forward and seems to be looking down at Jesus on the cross, with her arms bent upward and her hands clenched under her chin in gesture that suggests prayer.

To the left of Mary are two types of plants, one (rather vine-like) bearing lilies and the other bearing roses. Two leafy trees grow in the middle distance left of Mary, perhaps with their branches intertwined.
The middle distance is filled with leafy trees and perhaps other sorts of vegetation.
The ground is probably covered with grass; a small plant may grow beneath the cloth dangling from the cross.
A river runs in the middle distance with hills and a mountain behind.
To the left of Joseph's right shoulder is the roof, wall, and perhaps chimney of a building, probably a house.
The sky appears to be slightly cloudy, with coloring that suggests sunrise or sunset.
